newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany calls for EU-wide advertising regulations.
newsitem.headline: Germany calls for EU-wide advertising regulations.

text.p: German Justice Minister Edzard Schmidt-Jortzig on Wednesday called for a unified code of advertising regulations in Europe, saying the current system failed to provide sufficient direction for the industry.
Schmidt-Jortzig called the legal framework of advertising in Europe a "patchwork quilt" of guidelines and said advertising law lacked sufficient leadership from the European Commission.
"The European Commission has not revealed what it sees for the future of European advertising law," Schmidt-Jortzig told industry officials in Bonn.

"What is suggested is a (European) policy that will limit itself to intervening where advertisements violate the interests of other advertisers, where the customer is misled or harmed, or where they obstruct the public interest," he said.
